alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:05PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 804 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Newark to 11 miles south of Snow Hill to 11 miles northeast of Parksley. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties, including the following locations... Horntown, Hallwood, Boxiron, Public Landing, Greenbackville, Wallops Island, Temperanceville, Oak Hall, Cedartown, and Mount Wesley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and southeastern Virginia.
